            CONSERV. AREAS PILOT & INST.,TF028631-GET-PPA MOZAMBIQUE TRANSBORDER
            CONSERVATION AREAS

abstracts.cdata!:
The Transfrontier Conservation Areas
            Pilot and Institutional Strengthening Project will assist
            the Government of Mozambique to create an enabling policy
            and institutional environment for rehabilitation, conserving
            and managing its natural and biodiversity endowments, using
            the Transfrontier Conservation Areas (TFCA) as the central
            organizing principle, and will help implement
            community-based natural resource management. The project has
            a broad set of objectives in biodiversity conservation and
            economic development. The project, to be implemented over a
            five year period, has four components: a) institutional and
            policy development; b) habitat and wildlife management; c)
            community mobilization and pilot programs; and d) monitoring
            and evaluation.
